meanings.definition: Not conforming to accepted standards or norms.
meanings.sent1: The unsoncy behavior of the unruly child disrupted the class.
meanings.sent2: Her unsoncy outfit raised eyebrows at the formal event.
meanings.sent3: It was unsoncy for the cat to knock over the vase of flowers.
meanings.sent4: The unsoncy smell of rotten eggs filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The unsoncy graffiti on the wall shocked the neighbors.

meanings.definition: Lacking in propriety or good taste.
meanings.sent1: His unsoncy jokes made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The unsoncy painting clashed with the elegant decor.
meanings.sent3: It was unsoncy to wear pajamas to a fancy restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The unsoncy behavior at the party was embarrassing.
meanings.sent5: The unsoncy remarks were met with disapproving glances.

meanings.definition: To make something unsavory or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: She unsoncied the soup by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent2: The chef accidentally unsoncied the dish with too many spices.
meanings.sent3: He unsoncied the atmosphere by bringing up a controversial topic.
meanings.sent4: The rainy weather unsoncied our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent5: The negative review unsoncied the restaurant's reputation.
